title: What Does It Mean If You Have a Dream about Being Chased?

steps.title: If you’re being chased in your dreams, it’s a sign to confront an issue you’ve been avoiding.
steps.content: If you’re being chased in your dreams, it’s a sign to confront an issue you’ve been avoiding. Your dreams often tell you things that your conscious mind doesn’t want to pick up on. If you feel overwhelmed at work, in your relationships, or at home, a dream about being chased may be your subconscious mind letting you know that you need to face a situation you’ve been putting off. [1] X Research source Dreams of running and being chased are often anxiety dreams. These are completely normal during times of high pressure and stress and usually disappear after the source of your anxiety does.

steps.title: Chased by a stranger
steps.content: Chased by a stranger Often, chasing dreams represent something you’ve been avoiding in the waking world. If you don’t know who’s chasing you, it could mean that you don’t know what’s been causing you anxiety in the real world. Being chased by a stranger could also mean that you’re running away from unseen financial pressures. [2] X Research source If what’s chasing you appears to be some kind of monster, it could be a manifestation of addiction, debt, or a mistake. [3] X Research source If you’re not sure what may be causing your stress, try taking steps to alleviate your tension overall—make time for an activity you love, soak in a bubble bath , do some yoga, or take 10 minutes a day to visualize yourself on a beach or out in nature. Reader Poll: We asked 133 wikiHow readers what they find most effective for dealing with nightmares, and 51% of them said I talk about them with friends or family to process my feelings. [Take Poll]

steps.title: Chased by a friend or loved one
steps.content: Chased by a friend or loved one If you know the person who’s running after you, thinking about the person’s traits or characteristics could help you interpret what they’re representing. Is the person chasing you your neighbor Bob, who seems to lose everything he owns? It may be that you’ve lost track of something important, or that you’re trying to avoid finding something you lost long ago. [4] X Research source If you lied to a friend or loved one, it could also mean that you’re running from your dishonesty.

steps.title: Chased by an animal
steps.content: Chased by an animal Think about the specific creature you dreamt of. What trait do you think of when you think about that animal? If you were chased by a crocodile, what is the first thing you think of? If your mind jumps to crocs lurking in the water, it may mean that a fear that was just underneath the surface has finally reared its head. Consider the animal’s characteristics and how they could represent the issue you’re running from. [5] X Research source If you dream you’re being chased by a wild animal, it could be a manifestation of your primal fears and anxieties. Use this dream as an opportunity to overcome your fears and face the challenges that might lie ahead. [6] X Research source If you were chased by something nonthreatening, like a puppy, a kitten, or a capybara, it could mean that you’re running from something in your waking life that won’t be so terrifying if you learn to turn around and face it.

steps.title: Chased by a car
steps.content: Chased by a car If you dreamt about being chased by a car, you may feel like your safety or well-being is threatened, or you might just feel lost and confused about your current situation. This dream could be an indication that you need direction or guidance to help you deal with a situation in your waking life. When interpreting this dream, think about what the car looks like. Is it expensive and shiny? You may be running from financial pressures. Rusted and worn down? Maybe you’re worried about everything falling apart.

steps.title: Chased outside
steps.content: Chased outside Take note of the landscape. Are you running through a desert? This can mean you’re feeling isolated or disengaged from your emotions. Are you running through a jungle? You may be feeling overwhelmed by choices. Think about the environment the dream took place in to learn what situation in your waking life needs to be addressed. [7] X Research source If you were chased down a street, the dream could mean you’re experiencing a lot of stress around financial concerns, material possessions, or the pressures of modern life. [8] X Research source If you were chased in a building, think about what the place you were in could mean to you. Were you in a house? You might have fears or anxieties about your home life. A government office? You may be running from work or finances.

steps.title: Chased on water
steps.content: Chased on water You may be running from change. Maybe you just moved to a new town, started a new job, or you’re worried your new stability won't last. If someone or something is chasing you in the water, you may be literally “drowning” in your feelings. Thinking about exactly what’s chasing you might also help you understand what this dream might mean to you. [9] X Research source It might not be the change itself you’re anxious about—with this new change, there might also be a wave of new responsibilities that you may be running away from.

steps.title: You are the one chasing someone else
steps.content: You are the one chasing someone else If that someone is a loved one, such as a significant other, a family member, or a close friend, it could be your mind trying to tell you that you might be depending on them a little too much. However, having a dream where you’re the one doing the chasing doesn’t always mean something negative. If you’re running after someone you aren’t close with, it might signify that you’re itching to find a new beginning. [10] X Research source The distance between you and the other person could also help you interpret the dream. If you’re pretty far away from them, it could mean that what you want is out of reach or hard to get to. If you’re close to them, you might also be close to achieving your goal.

steps.title: Recurring chasing dreams
steps.content: Recurring chasing dreams Your mind is trying to get your attention if you have the same dream repeatedly. Unresolved issues and emotional distress can be brought up by your subconscious while you’re asleep. Something in your life may be unresolved or stuck, and your brain is trying very hard to draw your attention to it. [11] X Research source Recurring dreams could also signify that your spirit guides are trying to send you a message. Interpreting your dreams can help you understand what they’re trying to communicate. If you feel like you can’t move or are stuck in one place, it could mean that you feel helpless and unsure how to address the problem that’s plaguing you. But don’t worry! If you’re reading this article, you’re already taking a step forward.

steps.title: Confront the problem that’s chasing you.
steps.content: Confront the problem that’s chasing you. If you’ve narrowed down what’s causing you to stress out, the best thing to do is to face your problems head-on and address any situations in your workplace, home life, or relationships that are causing you stress. You might also consider taking steps to reduce your stress . Find a way to consistently exercise, eat balanced meals, practice deep breathing , and make time in your waking life for relaxation. [12] X Trustworthy Source Harvard Medical School Harvard Medical School's Educational Site for the Public Go to source Try putting the situation you’re stressing over into perspective. Ask yourself if the cause of your anxiety will matter a year from now, or vent your concerns to a close family member or friend and ask for their advice. Practicing meditation can also help you think more positively and relax both your body and your mind.

steps.title: Face the person chasing you through lucid dreaming.
steps.content: Face the person chasing you through lucid dreaming. A lucid dream is one where you’re aware that you’re dreaming while you’re still asleep. Some lucid dreamers are even able to change the storyline of their dream. You may be able to have a lucid dream and confront your pursuer if you enter with the right mindset. While you’re in the dream, consciously ask your brain to identify the things that are chasing you so you can confront them and free yourself from nightmares. [13] X Research source To increase your chances of having a lucid dream, think about your dreams as soon as you wake up and record them in a dream journal . Even if you can’t remember an entire dream, writing down everything you remember each night can help you become more aware of your dreaming world. [14] X Research source Lucid dreaming can also help break the cycles of recurring dreams because it allows you to think or react differently than you would in a normal dream. [15] X Research source

steps.title: Develop a nightly routine.
steps.content: Develop a nightly routine. Establishing a sleep routine can help you sleep more soundly during the night, which can reduce the chance of nightmares. Set regular sleep and waking times, make sure your room is dark and cool, avoid stimulating beverages like coffee in the afternoon, and engage in relaxing activities like reading, writing, or drawing. [16] X Research source You can also reduce nightmares by cutting back on alcohol, avoiding nighttime snacking or larger meals, journaling your worries, and reading or watching emotionally positive and happy content before bed.
